Article/0-0-0-18/jsx-elements.title: JSX elements
Article/0-0-0-18/jsx-elements.html:
Using HTML attributes<\/a><\/h2>

Nullstack JSX deviates a little from the spec.<\/p>

You can use the normal HTML attributes like class<\/code> and for<\/code> directly.<\/p> 

<<\/span>label<\/span> for<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>input"<\/span><\/span> class<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>dont-label-me"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> I<\/span> am a label </<\/span>label<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Headless components<\/a><\/h2>
If you want to skip rendering the component at all you can simply return false<\/code> from the render.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Headless<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>
 
  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> false<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Headless;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

This will allocate DOM space for when you decide to render markup there.<\/p>

This is also useful for conditional rendering.<\/p>

If all you want to do is to generate an invisible component you can skip defining the render method at all.<\/p>

Boolean attributes<\/a><\/h2>
Attributes can be assigned as a boolean.<\/p>

When the value is false<\/code> the attribute will not be rendered at all.<\/p>

When the value is true<\/code> it will be rendered as a boolean attribute without a string value.<\/p>

<<\/span>button<\/span> disabled<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>false<\/span>}<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> Button </<\/span>button<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

You can shortcut attributes when you know the value will always be true.<\/p>

<<\/span>button<\/span> disabled<\/span>><\/span><\/span> Button </<\/span>button<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>



âœ¨ Learn more about attributes<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Element tag<\/a><\/h2>
If you need to decide the tag name at runtime, you can use the element tag and set the tag attribute conditionally.<\/p>

<<\/span>element<\/span> tag<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>!<\/span>!<\/span>link ?<\/span> 'a'<\/span> :<\/span> 'span'<\/span>}<\/span><\/span> href<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>link ||<\/span> false<\/span>}<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
  some arbitrary text
</<\/span>element<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

When the tag attribute is omitted, Nullstack will default to a div<\/code>.<\/p>

Fragments<\/a><\/h2>
Fragments are elements that renders it's contents in the parent component.<\/p>

export<\/span> default<\/span> function<\/span> Fragmented<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
  return<\/span> (<\/span>
    <<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
      <<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>button<\/span>><\/span><\/span> I<\/span>'m a button!<\/span> </<\/span>button<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
      </<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
      <<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span> Paragraph!<\/span> </<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    </<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
  )<\/span>
}<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Wherever it is used, the above functional component will be rendered as follows:<\/p>

<<\/span>button<\/span>><\/span><\/span> I<\/span>'m a button!<\/span> </<\/span>button<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span> Paragraph!<\/span> </<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

SVG Elements<\/a><\/h2>
SVG can be used as if it were any regular HTML tag.<\/p>

You can manipulate the SVG using attributes and events normally.<\/p>

<<\/span>svg<\/span> height<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>size}<\/span><\/span> viewBox<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>0 0 100 100"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
  <<\/span>circle<\/span> cx<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>50"<\/span><\/span> cy<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>50"<\/span><\/span> r<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>40"<\/span><\/span> onclick<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>grow}<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
</<\/span>svg<\/span>><\/span><\/span> 
<\/code><\/pre>



âœ¨ Learn more about events<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Components with children<\/a><\/h2>
Your component can be invoked passing a block of content.<\/p>

<<\/span>Header<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> 
  <<\/span>h1<\/span>><\/span><\/span> Hello World </<\/span>h1<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
</<\/span>Header<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

This doesn't automatically render the block since it wouldn't know where to place it.<\/p>

You can destructure the children on the render method and place it in your markup.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Header<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>
 
  render<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>children}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>{<\/span>children}<\/span></<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Header;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>



âœ¨ This is possible because the children<\/code> key is part of the instance context<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Lists<\/a><\/h2>
You can map over lists without declaring a key<\/code>.<\/p>



âœ¨ A key in Nullstack is an ID for a specific component instance. Learn more about the instance key<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Lists that may change length must be wrapped in a parent element just for them.<\/p>

<<\/span>ul<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
  {<\/span>list.<\/span>map<\/span>(<\/span>(<\/span>item<\/span>)<\/span> =><\/span> <<\/span>li<\/span>><\/span><\/span>{<\/span>item.<\/span>name}<\/span></<\/span>li<\/span>><\/span><\/span>)<\/span>}<\/span>
</<\/span>ul<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

You can emulate a fixed-size list by returning false<\/code> instead of an element to reserve dom space.<\/p>

{<\/span>list.<\/span>map<\/span>(<\/span>(<\/span>item<\/span>)<\/span> =><\/span> (<\/span>
  item.<\/span>visible ?<\/span> <<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>{<\/span>item.<\/span>name}<\/span></<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span> :<\/span> false<\/span>
)<\/span>}<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

It's a nice practice to use inner components combined with lists to clean up your code.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> List<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  items =<\/span> [<\/span>
    {<\/span>visible<\/span>:<\/span> true<\/span>,<\/span> number<\/span>:<\/span> 1<\/span>}<\/span>,<\/span>
    {<\/span>visible<\/span>:<\/span> false<\/span>,<\/span> number<\/span>:<\/span> 2<\/span>}<\/span>,<\/span>
    {<\/span>visible<\/span>:<\/span> true<\/span>,<\/span> number<\/span>:<\/span> 3<\/span>}<\/span>
  ]<\/span>

  renderItem<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>visible,<\/span> number}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>!<\/span>visible)<\/span> return<\/span> false<\/span>;<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>li<\/span>><\/span><\/span> {<\/span>number}<\/span> </<\/span>li<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>
 
  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>ul<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        {<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>items.<\/span>map<\/span>(<\/span>(<\/span>item<\/span>)<\/span> =><\/span> <<\/span>Item<\/span><\/span> {<\/span>...<\/span>item}<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>)<\/span>}<\/span>
      </<\/span>ul<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> List;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Inner HTML<\/a><\/h2>
You can set the inner HTML of an element with the html<\/code> attribute.<\/p>

Links inside the HTML string will be replaced with routable anchors<\/a>.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Post<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  content =<\/span> `<\/span>
    <h1> This is a Post </h1>
    <a href="/other-post">
      Check this other post
    </a>
  <\/span>`<\/span><\/span>;<\/span>
 
  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>article<\/span> html<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>content}<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Post;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>



ðŸ”¥ Be careful! When using user-generated HTML you are in risk of script injection<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Body tag<\/a><\/h2>
Renderable components can render a body<\/code> tag an unlimited number of times at any depth of the application.<\/p>

The body<\/code> attributes of the body tag that are rendered will be merged into the real body tag in the DOM<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>body<\/span> class<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>bg-black"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        {<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>modalOpen &&<\/span>
          <<\/span>body<\/span> class<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>overflow-hidden"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
            <<\/span>div<\/span> class<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>modal"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> modal here <<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
          </<\/span>body<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        }<\/span>
      </<\/span>body<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Head tag<\/a><\/h2>
Renderable components can render inside the head<\/code> tag an unlimited number of times at any depth of the application.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
          <<\/span>head<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
            <<\/span>link<\/span> rel<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>preconnect"<\/span><\/span> href<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>https://www.googletagmanager.com"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
          </<\/span>head<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        </<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>head<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
          <<\/span>link<\/span> rel<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>preload"<\/span><\/span> href<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/roboto-v20-latin-300.woff2"<\/span><\/span> as<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>font"<\/span><\/span> type<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>font/woff2"<\/span><\/span> crossorigin<\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
          <<\/span>link<\/span> rel<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>preload"<\/span><\/span> href<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/crete-round-v9-latin-regular.woff2"<\/span><\/span> as<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>font"<\/span><\/span> type<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>font/woff2"<\/span><\/span> crossorigin<\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
        </<\/span>head<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
      </<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>



ðŸ”¥ You should not use the head<\/code> tag to update metatags<\/a> that Nullstack already controls<\/p>
<\/blockquote>
